data.title: A way to save and load groups of visual script nodes
data.body:
When working with visual scripts there are two options, make all from scratch or copy-paste a group of nodes from another visual script (meaning that the script must be added and opened in the editor).

I was thinking that having templates could be useful for generic things like input handling or character movement and more complex but commonly used operations, some kind of "visual snippet".
These templates could work just like copy-paste, but copied/pasted to/from files instead.

Something like this may increase a lot the usability of visual scripting.

--------
I don't know if I was clear on the request but, just in case, the basic idea is:
- Save the selected Visual Script nodes to disk (like a copy operation).
- Load saved nodes from disk and add them to the current Visual Script function (like a paste operation)
--------

ps: if these templates/snippets could be added to a customizable section on the available nodes list, even better, but as files could be enough.

data.title: Renaming functions in VisualScript doesn't work. (3.0)
data.body:
Right now you can not rename user created functions in Visual Script through the UI. Renaming them in the "Members:" dialog makes them uneditable in the graph editor and trying to rename them in the resource tab in the inspector doesn't really seem to do anything.

steps to reproduce:
1. create a visual script
2. hit "+" to create a new function
3. try to rename "new_function"

data.title: KinematicBody2D move does not update Collision Transform (only first move in _fixed_process does valid testing)
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1.2.stable.official

**Issue description:**
After moveing a KinematicBody2D with move(), the Collider transformations are not updated.
Every move will only test with the initial Collider position/transformation.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Setup a scene with 1 KinematicBody2D (A) and 1 StaticBody2D (B) with rectangular CollisionShape2D
- A is placed left to B (can have some space < 100px) and A and B CollisionSHapes are 64px x 64px
- add a script to A with code:
```
func _ready():
	set_fixed_process(true)

func _fixed_process(delta):
	move(Vector2(0, 100))
	move(Vector2(100, 0))
	set_fixed_process(false)
```

A only moves down, but not to the right.
Even though after moving down, A would fit under B.
It should be under B and should have moved in an L-shape (first down, then right).
Move does not update Colliders to new position, so while trying to move right, it seems to be blocked by B, as it would be, if we only moved right.

**Workaround:**
change _fixed_process to:

```
func _fixed_process(delta):
	move(Vector2(0, 100))
	var st = get_shape_transform(0) # get current shape transform, assuming we only have 1 shape
	st.o += get_travel() # add move translation to shape transform
	set_shape_transform(0, st) # update shape transform
	move(Vector2(100, 0))
        # you should reset the shape transform to its original state befor returing
	set_fixed_process(false)
```

data.title: [3.0] Mouse cursor stuck in "resizing" icon when the mouse exits window border
data.body:
Tested on Godot master 3ceefab232604b09d3fff843c24a13e99f50912b
Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:
1) Open Editor Settings (or any other resizeable editor window)
2) Move the mouse to a border, see it changes to a resizing icon
3) Move the mouse away from the window: notice the cursor stays a resizing icon (wrong behaviour).
4) Click outside of the window: notice the cursor becomes normal again

When doing 3), I expected the mouse to go back to a normal pointer.

data.title: Some WebGL 2 and build fixes/clean-up
data.body:
For WebGL 2, fix an inverted `#ifndef`.
Still fails with an error about a missing buffer in uniform binding 4:
```
drawElements: Buffer for uniform block is smaller than UNIFORM_BLOCK_DATA_SIZE.
```
Debug data:

- `UserName: OmniLightData`
- `DataSize: 65440`
- `BufferSize: 0`
- `IndexedUniformBufferBindings index: 4`

For the build:

- Remove dated build settings and remains from Android
- Enable `-O3` for `release`, which reduces size by almost 1MB for asm.js builds
- Fix optimization so compiling and linking use the same `-O` level for each target
- Retain function names in `release_debug`

data.title: The API to create a trimesh collision shape is confusing
data.body:
Creating collision shapes in 3D works the same as in 2D, except when it comes to trimesh collisions (aka mesh colliders).

The only way I found to produce a collider from a generated Mesh / tool is to call `MeshInstance.create_trimesh_collision()`, which returns nothing, and generates a StaticBody as child of the node, supposedly at last position. If the mesh changes, the node has to be found and `queue_free`d so `create_trimesh_collision` has to be called again to recreate them. It leads to code like this https://github.com/Zylann/godot_terrain_plugin/blob/master/addons/zylann.terrain/terrain_chunk.gd#L12

While it looks easy at first glance, it feel confusing and limited compared to what I was used to in 2D.
Instead of having to forcibly use a helper, I thought I could do something like:

```gdscript
var body = StaticBody.new()
var shape = TrimeshShape.new()
shape.set_mesh(mesh)
body.set_shape(shape)
parent.add_child(body)
```

In Unity it works the same, by simply assigning a Mesh to a MeshCollider.

But there is no TrimeshShape, but Concave and Convex polygon shapes. I understand they mostly are per-case optimized choices, but they are hard to deal with (they also require raw faces instead of a Mesh). Does it mean one or the other are built with the helper too?

The main things I don't like is that I'm forced to create a MeshInstance to create a mesh collider, that I'm unable to choose where the nodes go, and that I have to destroy and recreate them if I want to modify the mesh (assuming I can tell them apart).
It also makes it difficult if you need a high-poly MeshInstance with a low-poly collider.

data.title: Visual Scripting broken on latest builds?
data.body:
I noticed that having a visual script attached to any node, even if it doesn't contain any complicated logic, will cause the game window to close immediately after running the project without any error messages in the debugger. This must be a new issue, since i remember visual script working just fine a couple of weeks back.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a new project and add a node to it
2. attach a visual script to it and add some logic (or none at all)
3. run the project

data.title: In game inputs from non english layouts should be treated as their qwerty equivalent (like SDL2 scancodes)
data.body:
Linux Kubuntu 16.10 Godot 2.1.2 x64 official
Self descriptive. After switching layouts, in game inputs from keyboard are ignored. 

Expected behavior: processing inputs as if they are from english layout.

data.title: Remove warning on owner re-assignment (2.1)
data.body:
Sometimes you get a collection of warnings coming from scene instancing because it sets the owner of somes nodes repeteadly to the same owning node.

Please someone savvy about this have this checked, since I'm not completely sure this is a non-error situation indeed.

data.title: Remove warning on owner re-assignment
data.body:
Sometimes you get a collection of warnings coming from scene instancing because it sets the owner of somes nodes repeteadly to the same owning node.

Please someone savvy about this have this checked, since I'm not completely sure this is a non-error situation indeed.

data.title: Path for Engine/Editor/Plugin-used scenes/files?
data.body:
Writing a plugin may require a gui-scene. EDIT: in c++
But where save that?
as example:
lets say i write a terrain module,
i did this in the modules folder.
the plugin to edit the terrain, currently is there too.
but the plugin uses a gui-scene for display (in the dock)
now where put that tscn file?
in res:// it is now, but i dont want users of the plugin to always copy it there...
user:// seems completly wrong...

i think i need some sort of engine:// mapped to somewhere (loc of binary or $binaray/enginedata)?
but this breaks with "godot is a single file", 
if no such folder, i forced to hack my own, or limited to create the scenes programmatically only

data.title: Update mouse position on touch and release events (Android)
data.body:
Updates the mouse position when the user touches the screen. Fixes issue #1212 for Android.
I don't know if this was an issue on iOS too. Judging from the code, the mouse position should be updated correctly, so no changes are necessary for iOS, but I can't test it.

data.title: Custom node inheriting BaseButton does not appear in Create New Node dialog
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.x


**Issue description:**
It took me to create my own button. Based on the class of the base button. But I found out that this button is not shown in the dialog "create a new node". If I create my class from a button then my button is added to the list. The problem is that I do not need the functionality of the button. I need the basic button functionality that I want to extend. And this can not be done.
For a better understanding of the problem, I created an example.
In the menu "create new node" should appear 2 buttons created by me. But there is only one: (

plugin.gd
```
tool
extends EditorPlugin

func _enter_tree():
	add_custom_type("MyButton", "Button", preload("myButton.gd"), null)
	add_custom_type("MyBaseButton", "BaseButton", preload("myBaseButton.gd"), null)

func _exit_tree():
	remove_custom_type("MyButton")
	remove_custom_type("MyBaseButton")
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/233268/23940800/5811f9c4-0977-11e7-8651-25e0850b22cd.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
https://www.dropbox.com/s/py9r5c2lezu9n6b/BaseButton.zip?dl=0

data.title: Godot 3.0 Collisions Shapes (CollisionShape2D / CollisionPolygon2D) dont get drawn on the editor or debug, except RectangleShape2D, RayShape2D or LineShape2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04
Godot 3.0
gcc 5

**Issue description:**
When adding a CollisionShape2D different than a RectangleShape2D to a KinematicBody2D or StaticBody2D the CollisionShape2D is not drawn on the editor or when debugging collision shapes, except if it is a RectangleShape2D, RayShape2D or LineShape2D.
CapsuleShape2D, CircleShape2D, ConcavePolygonShape2D, ConvexPolygon2D dont get drawn
CollisionPolygon2D also dont get draw correctly, just the outline, but never the "blue" area inside the polygon


**Steps to reproduce:**
.--For CollisionShape2D:
1.-turn on see collision shapes for debug
2.-create a KinematicBody2D
3.-add a CollisionShape2D
4.-set the CollisionShape2D to capsule
5.-the CollisionShape wont be draw

.--For CollisionPolygon2D:
1.-turn on see collision shapes for debug
2.-create a StaticBody2D
3.-add a CollisionPolygon2D
4.-set the CollisionPolygon2D to Array Size 4 and add 4 vertexs:
(-10,-10),(-10,10),(10,10),(10,-10)
5.-the CollisionShape wont be draw

data.title: Engine crashes on Android when OTG keyboard is plugged in
data.body:
**Platform:** Android 5.1.1 - Godot v2.1.2

**Issue description:**
I have created simple game that reacts to keys W and S. Exported game runs fine without keyboard connected. 
When I connect usb keyboard via OTG cable while game is running, it crashes.
When I first plug the keybord, then run the game, it doesn't react to key presses.

Expectation is for keyboard to function properly whenever it's plugged before or while running an app.

Crash log: [otg_keyboard_crash.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/843400/otg_keyboard_crash.txt)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) install apk
2) run game
3) connect keyboard via otg
4) see the game crashed

**Link to minimal example project:**
[test_project.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/843402/test_project.zip)

data.title: Crash on MacOS after compilation from source.
data.body:

README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

MacOS 10.12.3 - commit 52ddd9ac9cf4074e6461a236808313002b0d83c4

**Issue description:**

After compiling from source, the editor crashed when going to edit a newly created project. The window remains, and the process cannot be force stopped from the Activity Monitor. Expected, would be that the editor loaded the project and shut down properly when closed.

data.title: Multi touch compatibility on desktop platforms
data.body:
Multi touch works perfectly on Android but not on Windows or Linux,  I tried this demo:

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/212251562553114624/275760789309095936/2017_01_30_23_48_46.mp4

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/212251562553114624/275763149007880192/multi_touch_test.zip

As expected this should work on Android (maybe on IOS as well) but not on desktop platform. These days there's plenty of Windows tablets with multi-touch support, it would be good to have the multi touch functionality from mobile devices extended to desktop platforms as well. I work for a company that uses multi touch devices and Unreal 4 to show the content and if I have Godot with multi-touch support on Windows/Linux I might be able to convince my superiors to change from UE4 to Godot.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8, Linux Redhat
Godot Engine 2.1.2-stable

data.title: Getting selected nodes in signal("selection_changed")-fired function results in endless loop
Positional trackers 2.1
data.body:
This is a work in progress at this point in time but hopefully something that will evolve pretty quickly. This is based off of the work I was doing for both cardboard style VR in iOS and OpenVR. I will be changing my OpenVR project soon to be based off of this. I'll also see if I can split the commit so the camera changes don't get mixed in.

The idea is to add support for positional tracking to the core of Godot on top of which an implementation can be build. This allows you, to the restrictions of a platform, to create your Godot game in a way so it can be deployed on different VR platforms. It also has usage outside of VR for tracked controllers such as a PS move style game. 

As an example I've added code to the iOS implementation that adds an HMD tracker with device orientation. Originally I wanted to base this off of iPhones internal rotationMatrix but I found out that Apple has a bit of a different idea. The code that processes the 9DOF sensor data is simplistic and far from perfect, but it suffices for now. It shouldn't be hard to add the few lines of code to make this available on Android as well. I really need to borrow an Android phone from someone. 

In GDScript you simply need to place the following somewhere in one of your process handlers:
```gdscript
var trackers = Input.get_connected_trackers(Input.TRACKER_HMD)
if (!trackers.empty()):
  camera_origin.set_transform(Input.get_tracker_transform(trackers[0]))
```
The reason get_connected_trackers returns an array is because this is also used for controllers and because tracking could be done by multiple sources. An example of this is NOLO VR which adds positional tracking. You would get orientation from your phone, and tracking from NOLO, while in OpenVR, or from the Oculus SDK it would all be combined.

As a result I may add some flags to this as well that communicate whether orientation, position or both are being tracked by a given tracker.

I will put my test project files online later in the week. 

I can't say much yet about tracking controllers. One departure I'm trying out from my first attempt at implementing OpenVR is that I'm splitting out positional tracking from controllers. A controller will thus appear both as a tracker and a joystick. Until I actually start building this however I can't give too much detail. 

Anyway, looking forward to getting some feedback. Oh and for now Godot 2.1, I'll port this over soon to Godot 3 as well probably after I've gotten some experience with using this for the controller implementation in my OpenVR project.

data.title: 3.x Renderer - Ambient Light for Materials?
data.body:
Would be great if we could setup different Ambient Light for materials to blend them with World Env Ambient Light.
Mostly for stylized art style.

data.title: List Control::has_point as a virtual method
data.body:
According to Issue #8018, a BIND_VMETHOD macro wasn't present in scene/gui/control.cpp, while it was declared to be a virtual method in scene/gui/control.h.

classes.xml was updated to also list this method in the Control class.

data.title: All GUI text is blurry except for labels
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1.2
Windows 10 64 bits

I created a theme with a custom font, and it looks fine with Labels. However, every other control gets blurry text instead. I expected the same result as the label, because I see the text appears to be the same size.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/23879326/a3386cfc-084c-11e7-954d-40582407fcf3.png)

[ItemListFontBlurry.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/839877/ItemListFontBlurry.zip)

Related QA thread I investigated from: https://godotengine.org/qa/13127/itemlist-font-is-scaled-and-blurry

data.title: Crash after change the dynamic font size by a mouse click+dragging
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu 16.04.2 LTS x86_64, **Godot version**: master 52ddd9a, 2.1 branch 8ea4413, 2.1.1-2.1.2 stable
**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Godot crash when change a dynamic font size by a mouse click+dragging.
Some time a size value has changed to a negative value, like: -2500 or lower.
![godot_dyn_font_size_crash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1049442/23869275/8c0116e2-084c-11e7-8bc9-5e2d55e3f19f.gif)
[godot_backtrace.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/839273/godot_backtrace.txt)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Add a node with a font support like a btn or label.
2) New DynamicFont.
3) Enter inside(edit it).
4) Font --> New DynamicFontData or Load some font.  Without this step godot work correct.
5) Try to change font size by a mouse click+dragging, up - down, several times.
6) Crash.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[bug_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/839303/bug_test.zip)

data.title: Control::has_point not listed as virtual method
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1/HEAD, but it seems like master is somewhat affected too

**Issue description:**
While coding some stuff for a (non-FOSS) game, I named one of my methods as `has_point` on a `CanvasItem`-inheriting script that was assigned to some controls. I made it to `return true`, since that was to be overriden by other scripts... And then, suddenly, all the controls with that script started grabbing all clicks :laughing:

I decided to search the docs, since I suspected something like this might have happened, but `Control::has_point` wasn't listed, since it isn't bound at all.

Note that the `has_point` implementation on [`scene/gui/control.cpp:572-588`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/5dbf1809c6e3e905b94b8764e99491e608122261/scene/gui/control.cpp#L572-L588) calls the script method.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Make a script with:
```gdscript
extends Control
func has_point(point):
    return true
```
2. Add it to a Button node
3. Run
4. Profit (or actually, cry)

**Link to minimal example project:** Partly in a hurry here, so, maybe later on request.

**How to fix:**
1. Go to [`scene/gui/control.cpp:2516`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/5dbf1809c6e3e905b94b8764e99491e608122261/scene/gui/control.cpp#L2516)
2. Add a proper `BIND_VMETHOD` macro, like here: [`scene/main/node.cpp:2923`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/5dbf1809c6e3e905b94b8764e99491e608122261/scene/main/node.cpp#L2923)
```c++
BIND_VMETHOD(MethodInfo("_process", PropertyInfo(Variant::REAL, "delta")));
```
3. Compile, make sure that the docs list `Control::has_point(Vector2 point)`
4. Make a PR
